meanings.definition: The final outcome or result of a series of events.
meanings.sent1: The payoff of the movie was unexpected.
meanings.sent2: The payoff for all his hard work was a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The payoff of the magic trick left everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: The payoff of the mystery novel revealed the true culprit.
meanings.sent5: The payoff of the game was a thrilling victory.

meanings.definition: A bribe or incentive given to someone in exchange for their cooperation.
meanings.sent1: The payoff to the informant secured valuable information.
meanings.sent2: The payoff for his silence was a large sum of money.
meanings.sent3: The payoff to the detective was a box of donuts.
meanings.sent4: The payoff to the witness ensured their testimony.
meanings.sent5: The payoff to the employee motivated them to work harder.

meanings.definition: The act of paying off a debt or loan.
meanings.sent1: The payoff of the mortgage marked the end of their financial burden.
meanings.sent2: The payoff of the credit card debt brought relief.
meanings.sent3: The payoff of the loan was celebrated with a small party.
meanings.sent4: The payoff of the car loan meant they owned the vehicle outright.
meanings.sent5: The payoff of the student loan was a weight off their shoulders.
